data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Every step to the right is a step forward. Walking forward takes 10 steps. Walking backwards takes 9 steps. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 4 steps to turn around and return with 4 steps to turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To walk, one needs 6 steps to make it back to the starting point. Turning around takes 4 steps to bring us back to where we started. To walk back around, we need 6 steps to make it back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking a step backwards goes the same as walking forward. To return to the starting point you must step backwards in total. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around and take 4 steps.

The one and only way to come back to start is to take 7 steps back and right once again. So, the answer is No.

The first step in the direction you are facing is always the forward one. In order to take 4 steps forward you take 1. This means that you are taking 4 steps forward again. If you take 6 steps forward you are taking 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you can do this exercise up to 3 times. So, the answer is Yes.

Once you step backward, you are no longer facing forward. Another way to say you are on the right side of the street. One of the ways to get backward is the same as facing forward. So, the answer is no.

The first step is always forward. The next step is back. The fourth step is to the right. The fifth step is to the left. So, the answer is no.

When facing forward, you always take three steps. When facing away, you always take one step back. When facing right, you always take one step forward. So, in total, the number of steps is 4. Therefore, the answer is yes.

A person facing backward takes 5 steps forward. If a person faces forward always, one will take 4 steps forward. If someone takes 5 steps backward and one takes 4 steps backward and one takes 9 steps forward, they will return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.
